string-array.item: Al-Aqal: It is placed over the hutrah/ghutra
Al-Farwah: lined with wool, worn in winter to prevent the cold
Sadu: is a type of old traditional weaving
Henna: It is used to dye hair and beard, and it is also used to beautify hands for women
Dallah: the bowl used for serving coffee among the Arabs
Slippers: made of leather, worn on the feet, was very popular with the Arabs
Dagger: a small white weapon placed on the waist
Al-Namraqa: A small pillow to lean on
The lamp: the name of the tool that was used for lighting in the past
Lantern: A tool used for lighting and decoration
The fez: a red hat popular in the Levant, Egypt and Morocco
Turban: a cover that is rounded over the head
The dishdasha: an Arab dress that is widely worn in the Gulf countries
